verses.verse: "How have you helped<WH5826> him who is without power!<WH3581> How have you saved<WH3467> the arm<WH2220> that has no<WH3808> strength!<WH5797>
How have you counseled him who has no<WH3808> wisdom,<WH2451> and plentifully<WH7230> declared<WH3045> sound knowledge!<WH8454>
To whom have you uttered<WH5046> words?<WH4405> Whose spirit<WH5397> came forth from you?<WH3318>
"Those who are deceased<WH7496> tremble,<WH2342> those beneath the waters<WH4325> and all that live in them.<WH7931>
Sheol<WH7585> is naked<WH6174> before God,<WH11> and Abaddon has no covering.<WH3682>
He stretches out<WH5186> the north<WH6828> over empty space,<WH8414> and hangs<WH8518> the earth<WH776> on nothing.<WH1099>
He binds up<WH6887> the waters<WH4325> in his thick clouds,<WH5645> and the cloud<WH6051> is not burst under them.<WH1234>
He encloses<WH270> the face<WH6440> of his throne,<WH3678> and spreads<WH6576> his cloud on it.<WH6051>
He has described<WH2328> a boundary<WH2706> on the surface of the waters,<WH6440> and to the confines<WH8503> of light<WH216> and darkness.<WH2822>
The pillars<WH5982> of heaven<WH8064> tremble<WH7322> and are astonished<WH8539> at his rebuke.<WH1606>
He stirs<WH7280> up the sea<WH3220> with his power,<WH3581> and by his understanding<WH8394> he strikes<WH4272> through Rahab.<WH7293>
By his Spirit<WH7307> the heavens<WH8064> are garnished.<WH8235> His hand<WH3027> has pierced<WH2342> the swift<WH1281> serpent.<WH5175>

Behold,<WH7098> these are but the outskirts of his ways.<WH1870> How small<WH8102> a whisper<WH1697> do we hear<WH8085> of him!<WH7482> But the thunder of his power<WH1369> who can understand?<WH995>"
